definitions.definition: Preparation for the future ; good governance ; foresight .
The careful governance and guidance of God (or another deity , nature , etc.).
A manifestation of divine care or direction ; an instance of divine intervention .
Specifically, the prudent care and management of resources ; thriftiness, frugality .
examples: His providence in saving for his old age is exemplary.

main_definition: ( now rare ) Preparation for the future ; good governance ; foresight . [from 14th c.]
secondary_definitions: The careful governance and guidance of God (or another deity , nature , etc.). [from 14th c.]
A manifestation of divine care or direction ; an instance of divine intervention . [from 16th c.]
Specifically, the prudent care and management of resources ; thriftiness, frugality . [from 17th c.]
